HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: App Permissions - Authorizing Application Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a LEA Super Administrator (or SEA Super Administrator on behalf of LEA), I would like to be able to decide what permissions will I give to the applications that I am authorizing for my district.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A functionality that will allow authorizing application with the default existing rights ( https://thesli.onconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2000832 )
  • What the user will be able to access is an intersection of the user and app rights. 
  • An UI in the Application Authorization Tool that will allow the LEA Super Admin (or its delegate) to choose which rights will be given to the application when the application is authorized for the District. This rights should be editable.
  • At all times there must be at least one choice selected
  • A message will be displayed to the admin for every application in the list, that will tell the LEA (or SEA) Super Administrator what kind of rights the app developer have asked for.
  • The LEA (or SEA) Super Administrator has a choice if he/she wants to give the rights that were asked for or not
  • An email notification will be sent explaining what kind of rights have been granted to the app. If the app is denied, email will be sent again

Wireframes: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Application+Authorization+Tool+Wireframes
Note: Please look at the image that is referenced with this story number.

FOR REVIEW BELOW
Demo Script:

A Daybreak LEA Super Administrator will authorize the Data Browser but will not select read restricted. Then the principal of south daybreak elementary will log in and traverse to a student that he/she knows has free and reduced lunch. He/she will not be able to access this info. Then the LEA Super Administrator will give the read restricted right to the Data Browser. The Leader will try to access the student again and will be able to see free and reduced lunch.

Gherkin:

Scenario: A LEA Super Administrator tries to authorize an application without choosing any right
Given I am a LEA Super Administrator
And I have navigated to the Application Authorization Tool
And I see a <pending app>
When I click on the Approve button
Then I get a message that I should choose at least any right

Scenario: A LEA Super Administrator authorized an application
Given I am a LEA Super Administrator
And I have navigated to the Application Authorization Tool
And I see a <pending app>
And it is in Edit mode by default (This is only because it is pending. Otherwise, the user would have to click on Edit)
And I click on <some rights>
When I click on Approve
Then the application has <some rights>

Scenario: Leader role having less rights because LEA Super Administrator have given less rights to the Data Browser
Given I am a Leader (role) 
And I am associated with <School>
And <School> is in <District>
And <District> LEA Super Administrator have approved the Data Browser
And has not give read restricted right
And <Student> is enrolled in <School>
And <Student> has free and reduced lunch
When I navigate to <Student> in Data Browser
Then I see <Student> info
And I don't see free and reduced lunch
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: App Permissions - Authorizing Application Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: An application that is authorized by an LEA, can access the LEA's data based on the user's permissions (on which behalf the application is accessing LEA's data) and the application features/capabilities. The LEA can give complete, blanket access to an application, but cannot restrict permissions to a more specific level. Additional functionality will be built to allow the LEA to choose what rights over the existing data categories to give to certain application. The intersection of the user's and application's permissions and the application's capabilities will define in which way the user will be able to access the LEA's data. For example, if an application allows editing of general student data, and a user with IT Administrator role (which gives permission for editing student data) is using the application, he/she will not be able to edit any student data if this right has not been given to the application by the LEA.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Current Courses and Grades Panel
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As an educator, I want to see a display of a student's currently enrolled courses and associated grades in their student profile.

(Mock up: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Dashboard--Current+Enrollment+and+Grades)

A/C:
  • Student current courses and grades are displayed.
  • Pixel perfect.
  • Missing data degrades gracefully.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Current Courses and Grades Panel
HierarchicalRequirement.Notes: Action item for Greg: Can a teacher see the grades for another class? Other enrollment info?
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: Student Profiles do not yet have a tab displaying a student's current courses and associated grades even if the data has already been ingested into SLI.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Stable URLs for Student Profile Pages
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a teacher, I want to be able to bookmark or share a profile URL with an authorized colleague.
As an IT Admin, I need to ensure that the data remains secure and that the student's GUID is not in that URL to prevent the story below.
Avoid this story: As a hacker, I want to use GUIDs in URLs to undermine data security.

  • Discussions with security have determined that the GUID should be encrypted to prevent data compromise.

AC:

URLs to student profiles are stable and canonical/bookmarkable, and also meet security protocols by removing GUIDs from URLs.

Note: when doing this story, if we choose to POST the GUIDs at each request, maybe add the security token in the same way (Robert's idea)
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Stable URLs for Student Profile Pages

Task.refObjectName: Code Revoew

HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: In the Dashboard, student profile and list URLs are unique and can be bookmarked. However, these will change at a later time with the ingestion of new data. As a result, they are not currently permanently canonical.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: App Permissions - Authorizing Existing Data Category Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
[Obsolete?] 

As a LEA Super Administrator, I would like to be able to decide what permissions will I give to the applications that I am authorizing for my district.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A functionality that will allow giving collection of (already existing rights) to the applications
  • The rights are the same ones as the rights or the default user roles (rights listed here: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=2000832)
  • What the user will be able to access is an intersection of the user and app rights. For example: A user of Daybreak with a role of Leader is using the Data Browser to traverse the data of his/her district, but the Data Browser is authorized with R Public and R General only. He/She will not be able to access the student's restricted data, even though his role has that right
  • An UI in the Application Authorization Tool that will allow the LEA Super Admin (or its delegate) to choose which rights will be given to the application when the application is authorized for the District. This rights should be editable.

Wireframes: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Application+Authorization+Tool+Wireframes
Note: Please look at the new - post alpha wireframe.

Demo Script:

A Daybreak LEA Super Administrator will authorize the Data Browser but will not select read restricted. Then the principal of south daybreak elementary will log in and traverse to a student that he/she knows has free and reduced lunch. He/she will not be able to access this info. Then the LEA Super Administrator will give the read restricted right to the Data Browser. The Leader will try to access the student again and will be able to see free and reduced lunch.

Gherkin:

Scenario: A LEA Super Administrator tries to authorize an application without choosing any right
Given I am a LEA Super Administrator
And I have navigated to the Application Authorization Tool
And I see a <pending app>
When I click on the Approve button
Then I get a message that I should choose at least any right

Scenario: A LEA Super Administrator authorized an application
Given I am a LEA Super Administrator
And I have navigated to the Application Authorization Tool
And I see a <pending app>
And it is in Edit mode by default (This is only because it is pending. Otherwise, the user would have to click on Edit)
And I click on <some rights>
When I click on Approve
Then the application has <some rights>

Scenario: Leader role having less rights because LEA Super Administrator have given less rights to the Data Browser
Given I am a Leader (role) 
And I am associated with <School>
And <School> is in <District>
And <District> LEA Super Administrator have approved the Data Browser
And has not give read restricted right
And <Student> is enrolled in <School>
And <Student> has free and reduced lunch
When I navigate to <Student> in Data Browser
Then I see <Student> info
And I don't see free and reduced lunch
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: App Permissions - Authorizing Existing Data Category Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: An application that is authorized by an LEA can access the LEA's data based on the user's permissions and the application features/capabilities. However, the LEA can only give an application complete, unrestricted access. Additional functionality will be built to allow the LEA to restrict rights to the existing data categories for an application.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Epic: Ingestion Progress
HierarchicalRequirement.Description: During Ingestion, I would like to view validation and ingestion progress for each data file per LEA/SEA
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Epic: Ingestion Progress
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: During bulk data ingestion, there is no progress indication for an ingestion job until the job is complete. The uploaded .zip file is immediately removed from the user's landing zone and the job log file(s) do not appear in its place until the job is complete.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Add Pagination to List of Students
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
List of Students currently does not support pagination. Add the pagination component similar to the one used in student search.


A/C:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Add Pagination to List of Students
HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: The Dashboard currently displays a maximum of 50 students in a section. Also, the Dashboard does not support pagination.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Super Admin Management Tool
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
old name: Create Super Admin Account

Persona: IT Admin - SEA Story: As a state admin, I want to be able to onboard my district(s) by creating the appropriate super administrator accounts.
 
Acceptance Criteria:
 

A web interface (as part of SLIs admin tools) that will allow to a valid State (designated) super admin only, to view/add/remove/manage all the necessary super admins for the State.


https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Hosted+Administrators+Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Super Admin Management Tool
HierarchicalRequirement.Notes: Does not include creating directories. Does not include creating ingestion landing zones.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: Password Reset for SLI Hosted Users
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
I would like to be able to reset passwords of the (SLI IDP) hosted users, so they are able to log in in case they have forgotten their password.

Acceptance Criteria:
  • On the simple-idp login page add a "reset my password" link.
  • It should invalidate the account and send the welcome/validate email.
  • User can click link and is prompted to reset their password.
  • (in PI5) Link could also be added to the edit user account page in SAMT
Demo Script:
SLI hosted user (once as super admin once as app developer) will go to the login page. He/she will then click on the Reset password URL and type in the email with which he/she is registered on SLI. Then he/she will open own mailbox, click on the temp URL (within the expiration date) and be redirected to a reset password page. He/she will then reset own password and log in afterwards with the new one.

Gherkin:

Scenario: SLI hosted user asks for password reset
Given I am <any> SLI hosted user
And I have navigated to the SLI IDP page
And I see Reset my password link
And I click on it
And I am presented a text field
And I type the email I am registered with
When I click on Submit button
Then I get message that an email has been sent to me
And an email with temporary (1day expiration) password reset url has been sent to me

Scenario: SLI hosted user clicks on temp password reset URL and resets the password
Given I am <any> SLI hosted user
And I have received temp reset password email
And I have clicked on the URL within the <expiration period>
And I was redirected to a reset password IDP page
And I have typed my new password into the new password text field
And I have re-typed my new password into the confirm new password field
When I click on the Submit button
I get a message that my password has been reset
And my password has been reset

Scenario: SLI hosted user clicks on temp password after the expiration period
Given I am <any> SLI hosted user
And I have received temp reset password email
And the expiration period have passed
When I click on the URL
Then I get a message (on a page) that the URL invalid/expired
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: Password Reset for SLI Hosted Users

Task.refObjectName: Provide the forgot password link on the login page
Add the password reset module
Unit Tests
Generate the secure url/email for changing password
Verify the email existence during the password reset
Allow adding new password on legitimate URL
unit test failed for change_password module

HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription: When SLI hosted directory users forget their passwords, they must ask the SLC Operator (in an offline process) to reset their passwords. A feature will be added to the SLI Identity Provider that allow the SLI hosted directory users to reset their passwords.

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT - Create, Edit, Delete Admin + UI
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
I would like to have a tool that will allow management of 'super-admins'

Acceptance Criteria:
An interface that will allow users with default SLI hosted admin roles (SLC Operator, SEA Super Administrator, LEA Super Administrator) to CRUD super-admins

General business rules:
  • There must be at least one SLC Operator at all times
  • If there is only one SEA Super Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
  • If there is only one LEA Super Administrator for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted
  • If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
  • If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular LEA (multiple LEAs to do), then it cannot be deleted
  • If there is only one Ingestion User for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
  • If there is only one Ingestion User for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted

Wireframes and more business rules here (TO DO: Review wireframes with Mistique):  https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Super+Administrator+Management+Tool+Wireframes 

Demo Script:

Gherkin:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT - Create, Edit, Delete Admin + UI

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT: API for Read for Admin accounts
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
AC:
Implement the business logic for reading admin accounts using CUD API

General business rules:
    •    There must be at least one SLC Operator at all times
    •    If there is only one SEA Super Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one LEA Super Administrator for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular LEA (multiple LEAs to do), then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Ingestion User for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Ingestion User for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted

For Sandbox:

The need is for the tenant owner/ sandbox owner to create both admin accounts and app developer accounts.
  • Today the developer only gets "App Developer" and "Ingestion User" rights, we can update it the App Developer role can have an optional permission to manage accounts. That will collapse the SEA/LEA permissions to create an account.

Additional information at:
https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Super+Administrator+Management+Tool+Wireframes 

Discussion Notes:
Decided to have granular permissions:

* right to add a new SLC Operator user

* right to add a new SEA user

* right to add a new LEA user

* right to add a new Sandbox_Admin

* right to add a new App_Developer

* right to add a new Ingestion_Admin


AT: Attached.
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT: API for Read for Admin accounts

Add new rights

* right to add a new SLC Operator user

* right to add a new LEA user

*right to add a new Realm Admin

* right to add a new Sandbox_Admin

* right to add a new App_Developer

* right to add a new Ingestion_Admin



need to map these rights to roles (also need to consider roles have no aware of sandbox and production env):

*SLC Operator

*SEA Admin

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT: UI for creating Admin Accounts - Production
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
AC:

  • Includes interface for Account Creation Page and Account Listing Page
  • When the user logs in (s)he is taken to the Account Listing Page with all accounts at the users level and below are listed.
  • When the user hovers over a row, then an Edit and Delete option are shown.
  • "Add User" and Edit takes the user to Account creation Page
  • For Edit the account creation is pre filled with existing information
  • Once account is created/edited the user is taken back to the listing page, and a success message is shown on top.
  • Search box will be add, made functional in a later story - not in scope for this story
  • Ed-Org column is filled only if the user has an Ed-Org associated
  • User should not be able to delete himself
  • User should not be able to change his role.
  • User is not able to log in unless he has created a password for the account
  • Until later stories are played, the Tenant and EdOrg are Text boxes not drop-down
  • Tenant  textbox is only visible to SLC operators and applicable if the new user role is not a SLC operator
  • Interfaces with the SAMT API

* Must be accessible to users with admin rights from portal.
* Must be called Admin Account Management Tool on Production
* Interacts with the API created in US3070


Wireframes: attached

AT: attached
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT: UI for creating Admin Accounts - Production

Parent.refObjectName: SAMT - Create, Edit, Delete Admin + UI

Task.refObjectName: refactor user active resource in rail for production env
refactor controller for production env
refactor create/edit view page for production env
create gherkin for SAMT CRUD test (production)

  • When the user logs in (s)he is taken to the Account Listing Page with all accounts at the users level and below are listed.

  • "Add User" and Edit takes the user to Account creation Page

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT: API for Create, Update, Delete for Admin accounts
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
AC:
Implement the business logic for creating/update/delete of admin accounts using CRUD API

General business rules:
    •    There must be at least one SLC Operator at all times
    •    If there is only one SEA Super Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one LEA Super Administrator for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Realm Administrator for particular LEA (multiple LEAs to do), then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Ingestion User for particular tenant, then it cannot be deleted
    •    If there is only one Ingestion User for particular LEA, then it cannot be deleted

For Sandbox:

The need is for the tenant owner/ sandbox owner to create both admin accounts and app developer accounts.
  • Today the developer only gets "App Developer" and "Ingestion User" rights, we can update it the App Developer role can have an optional permission to manage accounts. That will collapse the SEA/LEA permissions to create an account.

Additional information at:
https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/Super+Administrator+Management+Tool+Wireframes

AT:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT: API for Create, Update, Delete for Admin accounts

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT: As a developer I am asked to accept terms-of-use when I set my password for the first time, if I haven't accepted them before
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
Developers whose accounts are created via the SAMT interface need to accept terms-of-use for sandbox.

AC:
Sandbox:
* Sandbox user accounts created through the SAMT tools are not in "active" until TOU have been accepted and a password set
* If an account is not in "active" state then a check box stating TOU acceptance is displayed when the user is forced to change password.
* The user is not accepted to submit a password until they accept the TOU 
* Once the user changes password, their new password and their acceptance is recorded
* The checkbox is not displayed on later screens to change password

Production:
* Admin accounts created through the SAMT tools are not in "active" until a password is set
* If an account is not in "active" user is forced to change password
* Once the user changes password, their new password and their acceptance is recorded
* The checkbox is not displayed on later screens to change password

Wireframes: Page 6, 11

AT:
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT: As a developer I am asked to accept terms-of-use when I set my password for the first time, if I haven't accepted them before

Parent.refObjectName: SAMT - Create, Edit, Delete Admin + UI

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT - Notifying Created Hosted Admins and developers on sandbox
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
I would like to notify the SEA/LEA super admins when their accounts are being created. (on production)
I would like to notify the developers added to sandbox tenancy that their account has been created (on sandbox)

Acceptance Criteria:
Link to portal
What role has been assigned to them
The account initially is in the disabled state. The email contains a link that points to the password reset module.

Please find the notification messages here: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Notifications

Workflow: Look at attachment to see when notifications  are triggered

Email Contents: See attached
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT - Notifying Created Hosted Admins and developers on sandbox

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a SLC Operator or a tenant 'super-admin' I would like to be able to access the Super Account Management Tool.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • A right that will be assigned to the SLC Operator, SEA Super Administrator and LEA Super Administrator that will allow them to access the Super Administrator Management Tool. This right should be assigned only to those roles.
  • Appropriate update of the api/rest/userapps 
  • Update in both of the tables of https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Hosted+Administrators+Rights
Demo Script:

Sample users with the roles SLC Operator, SEA Super Administrator, LEA Super Administrator, Realm Administrator and Ingestion User will authenticate on the SLI hosted IDP, go to the Portal Admin page, see the SAMT tool in their available admin apps, will click on it and will be sent to its page.

Gherkin:

Scenario: SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User authenticate on the Super Administrator Management Tool
Given I am a valid authenticated SLI hosted user
And my role is <SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User>
When I hit the SAMT page
Then I am redirected to it

Scenario: SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User make api/rest/userapps call
Given I am a valid authenticated SLI hosted user
And my role is <SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User>
When I make the userapps call
Then I get the list of my available apps
And one of them is SAMT
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement (Access to SAMT tool for Operators and Administrators)
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a SLC Operator or a tenant 'super-admin' I would like to be able to access the Super Account Management Tool.

Acceptance Criteria:

  * Operators and Administrators have access to samt in the portal Admin page.
  * Passes Gherkin below
  *Sandbox SLC Operator does not have access to the Sandbox version of SAMT
Demo Script:

Sample users with the roles SLC Operator, SEA Super Administrator, LEA Super Administrator, Realm Administrator and Ingestion User will authenticate on the SLI hosted IDP, go to the Portal Admin page, see the SAMT tool in their available admin apps, will click on it and will be sent to its page.

Gherkin:

Scenario: SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User authenticate on the Super Administrator Management Tool
Given I am a valid authenticated SLI hosted user
And my role is <SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User>
When I hit the SAMT page
Then I am redirected to it

Scenario: SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User make api/rest/userapps call
Given I am a valid authenticated SLI hosted user
And my role is <SLC Operator/SEA Super Administrator/LEA Super Administrator/Realm Administrator/Ingestion User>
When I make the userapps call
Then I get the list of my available apps
And one of them is SAMT
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement (Access to SAMT tool for Operators and Administrators)

Task.refObjectName: implement acceptance test
Update admin rights confluence page

HierarchicalRequirement.refObjectName: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement (Define roles and rights to access SAMT)
HierarchicalRequirement.Description:
As a SLC Operator or a tenant 'super-admin' I would like to be able to access the Super Account Management Tool.

Acceptance Criteria:
 * Define the rights that will be assigned to the SLC Operator, SEA Super Admin, LEA Super Admin.
 * Define the roles and rights for the sandbox equivalent of the above.
 * Update in both of the tables: https://thesli.onconfluence.com/display/sli/SLI+Hosted+Administrators+Rights
HierarchicalRequirement.Name: SAMT - Page Authorization Enforcement (Define roles and rights to access SAMT)

Task.refObjectName: Add right and roles info to wiki page
Review wiki page
Define roles and rights for SAMT tool

HierarchicalRequirement.ReleaseNoteDescription:
Currently, the SLC Operator creates and manages every SLI hosted administrative user for a tenant by using an LDAP browser. A tool will be built that allows individual tenants to create and manage their own users. 

The SLC will still have to create the first user for the tenant.
